subject: Travel
title: Troy: From Myth to Reality
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Troy: From Myth to Reality.

hook.text: For centuries, scholars said Troy was a myth. Then an amateur archaeologist found it in Turkey.

buildup.text: Heinrich Schliemann was obsessed with Homer's Iliad. He believed Troy was real and spent years searching.

discovery.text: In 1870, he found the ruins at Hisarlik. Nine cities had been built on top of each other over millennia.

twist.text: Schliemann dug too fast, destroying layers of history. He damaged the very city he was trying to save.

climax.text: Modern archaeologists have confirmed a major city existed there. Whether Homer's war happened is still debated.

punchline.text: He found Troy, then accidentally destroyed parts of it.

quiz.question: Where was the ancient city of Troy found?
